document.masterDocTitle: A Rosetta Stone for eastern Pacific Caecidae (Gastropoda: Caenogastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Rosetta Stone for eastern Pacific Caecidae (Gastropoda: Caenogastropoda)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Caecum semicinctum de Folin, 1867a: 42
, 17 syntypes MNHN-IM-2000-4587, Panama .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. In addition to the type material the following lots were examined. NHMLAC:
LACM 1972 - 63.90 , Cano Island , Puntarenas Prov. , Costa Rica ,
8–13 m
, 12 sh
.
SBMNH :
SBMNH 452504 , Bahia Santiago , Colima , Mexico ,
27–40 m
, 20 sh
;
SBMNH 452521 , Bahia de Culebra , Guanacaste , Costa Rica ,
13–23 m
, 10 sh
;
SBMNH 619852 , Isla Danzante , Baja California Sur , Mexico ,
60–90 m
, 1 sh
;
SBMNH 620486 , Isla Danzante, NE end, Baja California Sur , Mexico ,
60–90 m
, 1 sh
;
SBMNH 621646 , ICP-03-012, Coiba National Park , Veraguas , Panama ,
5–19 m
, 9 sh
;
SBMNH 621649 , Isla de Coiba , Veraguas , Panama , 1 sh
;
SBMNH 622497 , Bahia Santiago , Colima , Mexico ,
13 m
, 4 sh
.

Original diagnosis. “Testa elongata, cylindrica, paulo arcuata, subcornea, fulgente, annulis rotundatis parum prominentibus cincta, (interstitiis minimis) deinde levi; aperturam versus annulis rotundatis ornata; apertura haud declivi, simpliciter marginata; septo mamillato, obtusissimo, subspirali, annulum rotundatum super septi planum fingente; margine laterali arcuato, convexo; operculo?” de Folin (1867a: 42) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 66.
Caecum semicinctum
. A . Profile view with periostracum (LACM 1972-63.90). B . Profile view without periostracum (LACM 1972-63.90). C . Ventral view (SBMNH 452504). D . Syntype, MNHN-IM-2000-4587. E . Operculum, exterior surface (SBMNH 452504).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and Habitat. From Isla Danzante, Baja California Sur , Mexico to Panama Bay, Panama . Intertidal to
90 m .
Uncommon on coarse sand and rocky substrates.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 67.
Caecum semicinctum
shells at different growth stages. A . Teleoconchs II to III (SBMNH 452504). B . Surface of teleoconchs II to III (SBMNH 452504). C . Teleoconchs III to V (LACM 1972-63.90). D . Surface of teleoconch IV (LACM 1972-63.90). E . Teleoconchs IV to V (LACM 1972-63.90). F . Teleoconch V (LACM 1972-63.90). G . Surface of teleoconch V (SBMNH 452504). H . Apertural rings of teleoconch V (SBMNH 452504). I . Teleoconch V (SBMNH 452504).

FIGURE 68.
Caecum semicinctum
. A . Conceptual reconstruction of growth stages. B . Species distribution map.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The type material of
Caecum semicinctum
is comprised of both subadult and adult specimens (MNHN-IM-2000-4587, Fig. 66D ). Neither Keen nor Lightfoot ever mentioned this species.
Caecum semicinctum
is somewhat uncommon, but easily recognizable.
